Skills

Abilities

Ability Lvl
Select an ability to see its description.
Gain more actions in combat.
Level 1 - No energy penalty when repeating an action.
Level 2 - Gain a third action by spending 2 energy.
Level 3 - Third action no longer costs 2 energy.
Your character can temporarily increase a proficiency.
Level 1 - Adept: Prior to attempting any proficiency, you can spend 1 resource to increase your proficiency level by 1.
Level 2 - There is now no limit to the amount of times you can use Adept for a given action.
Level 3 - Adept now uses 1 resource to increase the proficiency by 2.
Gain the Analyze ability - Learn the exact challenge to beat for any action or the exact health of a target.
Level 1 - Can use Analyze 3 times a play session.
Level 2 - Analyze can be used 5 times a play session. Determining the health of enemy targets no longer count towards this limit.
Level 3 - Using analyze on your own character actions no longer counts toward the play session limit.
Gain Cleave : when hitting an enemy with a melee attack, it'll also hit the enemy adjacent to your target and within your range.
Level 1 - Cleave deals half damage to the secondary target.
Level 2 - Cleave can hit an additional target.
Level 3 - Cleave deals full damage to secondary targets.
Your character can spend resources to improve the rolls of other characters.
Level 1 - Go Team!: Prior to another player making a roll, you can spend 1 energy to improve their roll by 1d4.
Level 2 - If You Can't Do It!: You can now spend as much energy as you like to improve a roll.
Level 3 - Nobody Can!: You can now retroactively improve rolls after a player rolls it. This costs 2 energy to do so.
Your character gains the Knowledge ability. You can attempt any untrained skill at skill level 1 as long as you pass an active intelligence check.
Level 1 - Can use Knowledge twice a play session.
Level 2 - Knowledge no longer has a play session limit.
Level 3 - Knowledge can now attempt at skill level 2.
Your character moves more spaces.
Level 1 - Movement speed bonus +1
Level 2 - Movement speed bonus +2
Level 3 - Movement speed bonus +3
Your character gains bonuses from stealth attacks.
Level 1 - Gain an additional free attack roll when attacking unnoticed from stealth.
Level 2 - Gain an additional 1d6 damage roll per successful attack when attacking unnoticed from stealth.
Level 3 - When attacking from stealth, both attack and damage rolls gains a +2 bonus.
Gain the Mulligan ability - Re-roll any roll. Limited uses per play session.
Level 1 - Can use Mulligan once a play session.
Level 2 - Can use Mulligan twice a play session.
Level 3 - Can use Mulligan three times a play session
Your character gains reaction attacks to enemy melee attacks.
Level 1 - Fast as Lightening: Successful dodging or grab-breaking gives you a single dice melee attack reaction.
Level 2 - A Little Bit Frightening: Successful dodging or grab-breaking gives you a full melee attack reaction.
Level 3 - Kungfu Fighting: Making a successful melee attack prepares you for dodging.
A new evolutionary path awaits.
Level 1 - Your character can no longer utilize any skills, most abilities, and most proficiencies. Any ranged attack roll made with a gun or projectile weapon is halved. Your character's Intelligence and Charisma is limited to 0, and Sanity max is limited to 25. Strength, Perception, and Dexterity can now be increased up to 8. You may add your strength modifier to any melee damage. You cannot level up this ability through regular means.
Level 2 - ???
Level 3 - ???
Allows you to add bonus rolls to ranged attacks without spending any additional ammo.
Level 1 - Snipe: Spend 1 action on your turn to add 1 free attack roll to any ranged attack.
Level 2 - Snipe now adds 2 free rolls.
Level 3 - As long as you don't move on your turn, you no longer need to spend an action to use Snipe.
Gain the Counseling ability, which restores sanity to other players. Any character can only receive counseling at most once a day
Level 1 - Counseling restores 1d4 + charisma. This can be used twice a day.
Level 2 - Counseling restores 1d6 + charisma. Gain one additional use per day.
Level 3 - Counseling now restores 1d10 + charisma and restores a minimum of 4 sanity.

Flaws

Select a flaw to see its description
Your character cannot restore resources unless they consume 2 alcohol in a day.
Moving more than 5 spaces in a turn causes your character to take damage.
If you roll an initiative of 8 or lower, your first action will be a Stress Response.
Whenever you roll a natural 1, there is a chance the outcome becomes a catastrophic failure, leading to a butterfly effect chain that ends in a disaster. This can occur no more than once a play session.
Your character occasionally slips up and causes an accident. This can occur no more than two times a play session.
Your character only restores 2 energy per unit of food.
Health regain effects are reduced by 50%.
If your character takes damage, roll a passive luck check. If that check fails, your glasses break and you receive a heavy penalty to ranged attacks and perception checks.
Your character is more prone to random sanity loss checks. If ever in combat with overwhelming odds, receive a penalty to all attacks.
Your character does not get a Long Rest bonus for resource restoration.
Your character has a rare, incurable disease. Your character now has a daily consumption requirement of 1 special medicine. If starting the game with this flaw, start with 2 special medicine.
Two times a play session, the ZM can force you to re-roll any roll. Any resources spent on the initial roll are refunded.
NPCs will typically start off with a bad first impression of you and generally mistrust you.
